other_tests.findings: Basal levels of androgens were low, and progesterone levels were high; basal cortisol was within the normal range, but rose insufficiently after ACTH.
Basal cortisol did not respond to ACTH stimulation.
Confirmed the absence of 17-hydroxylase and 17,20-lyase activities in patient 1; patients with mutations in the steroid-binding domain displayed combined 17-hydroxylase and 17,20-lyase deficiencies.
In patients 3 and 4 with R347C mutation, basal levels of androgens were low, and ACTH stimulation showed low-normal levels of cortisol that did not rise.
Patients underwent surgery several times without complications.
